intro: ^[The stranger looks to be rather dumbfounded.]
^We, uh… don’t get a whole lot of visitors.
^[The stranger sheepishly rubs the back of his neck.]

g-0: ^I’d offer to help fix up that boat of yours, but…
^[Bengt shifts awkwardly before he continues on.]
^I’m sorry to say, I don’t think it can be salvaged.
g-1: ^But, hey! You’re in one piece, at least! No need to look so glum!
g-2: ^Anyway, what happened just now? What was that... thing that attacked me?
^[Bengt hums and scratches his head before he speaks up again.]
^Well, uh, surprise! That’s what attacked you.
g-3: ^Oh, shoot! I don’t mean to scare you or anything.
^It’s a real menace. We have our ways of avoiding it, but… for an outsider, that must be quite a shock.
^Actually, a lot of things about this archipelago might seem weird to you. It’s a pretty strange place.
^When you’ve lived here as long as me, you just sorta get used to it!
^[You’re at a complete loss for words, but Bengt just laughs heartily.]
g-4: ^I was sent this letter by someone who claims to live around here.
^[Bengt ponders for a moment before his eyes widen.]
^Well, we did find a boat, but that was a whole decade ago.
^Sorry, letters are… not very easy to send out from here. Whoever wrote this might’ve been trying to reach you for a very long time by now.

c-5: ^Did you happen to see my parents at all, back then? Do you know where they were going?
^Err, no... I can't really help you there, unfortunately.

g-5: ^I see. That makes things harder for me...
^That boat belonged to your parents, then?
^I guess I owe it to you to give it back, but it’s in bad shape.
^It still works, but I don’t recommend taking it outside the archipelago. It might not hold out for very long.
g-6: ^You mentioned you’re a mechanic. Could you repair it for me?
^Some work for these idle hands? Why, I’d be happy to help you!
^Thing is, if I’m going to repair that boat for you, I’ll need materials.
^I have some right here on this island, but most of what I need is elsewhere.
^How about we work out a deal? I’ll give you your parents’ boat and repair it as much as I’m able, as long as you bring me the materials I need.

c-8: ^Why don’t you get them yourself and I’ll just pay you?
^Collecting materials can be pretty time-consuming, and I've got work to do! I'd be better off staying put.
^And frankly, I don’t need payment. We get by with favors around here, as you'll most likely find out for yourself.
^[It sounds like there’s a very close-knit community among the residents here.]
c-9: ^Oh, right! Let me tell you how to avoid that meddlesome thing.
^You can tell it's nearby by looking at the water.
^If there's a spot where it bubbles, that's where the Kraken is lurking.
^Just go around it and you'll be fine. Easy as pie!
^Should you happen to run into it, swat at its tentacles! That oughta drive it away.

g-7: ^Alright, I’m in. I'll get some materials for you.
^The boat has been collecting dust in my workshop for a long while now. I’ll show it to you.
^Just head on over to the building with the big wrench on it when you’re ready!

tutorial: ^Not looking too good, right? Well, no worries, we’ll get it fixed up one step at a time!
^(Blah blah blah tutorial on the upgrading system.)
^We’ll want to start off by repairing that compass of yours. Luckily, I already have the materials we need.
^Give me a sec and I'll get straight to it!
^[Bengt spends the next several minutes fixing your compass]
^[When he finishes, he presents it to you with a big smile on his face.]
^Next up is the X. We’ll need Y for this one.
^Sigrid, our lighthouse keeper, has some Y on her island. Why don’t you give her a visit?
^It’s just west of here. You can use your newly repaired compass, it'll point the way.
^Oh, and Sigrid might be alarmed if she sees a stranger rummaging through her turf.
^So please do talk to her before you do anything!
^Just let her know I sent you and you should be good to go.
^I'll write a letter for you to show her, just in case.

g-0: ^Head west and talk to Sigrid, got it. Anything else?
^Hmm… I think that’s everything! Off you go now, and good luck!
^[Bengt gives you a pap on the shoulder and disappears into his workshop.]
^[You can’t help but feel like you’ve been sent out on a goosechase. Coming here was a bad idea.]
^[But your parents’ boat confirms to you that this might be where they went missing.]
^[Where else could they have gone without it?]
^[And if Sigrid is this archipelago’s lighthouse keeper, she might’ve seen them at some point.]
^[You’ve long since lost hope that your parents could be alive...]
^[...but it might bring you some peace of mind to at least find out what happened to them.]
^[For now, you’re stuck here regardless. Thanks, Kraken.]
